History of the Atlantic Union Bank Center

The Atlantic Union Bank Center opened in November, 2020 as the sparkling new home of the James Madison University men’s and women’s basketball programs, while also opening the door to a multitude of other events to benefit the campus and the local community. It stands as the preeminent facility of its type in the entire Shenandoah Valley.

The Convocation Center debuted as home to JMU basketball in 1982. Plans for a new facility were first publicly shared in April of 2015. In October of 2017, Union Bank & Trust was named as the naming partner for the venue. General contractor S.B. Ballard broke ground on the construction project in April of 2018, and in spring of 2019 a rebrand by the naming partner resulted in the facility’s new official name as the Atlantic Union Bank Center.

In addition to S.B. Ballard as general contractor, Moseley Architects worked in collaboration with Populous on the facility design process. Anthony James Partners designed the technology infrastructure of the building while Advent took the lead on graphic design elements. The completed building includes two primary sections with a 8,500-seat event venue as well as a comprehensive basketball program area, designed to maximize student-athlete success across all aspects of the collegiate experience. The project also included construction of a 1,500-car parking deck, which officially opened in the Fall of 2019.

Features of the building include:

Retractable end line bleachers to accommodate concert and event configurations

Club room adjacent to lower seating bowl accommodating approximately 500 guests and featuring dedicated restrooms, two private suites, loge seating and multipurpose space for game day events, speakers or 200-person banquet events

Courtside seating & private event-level lounge area with dedicated restrooms

A comprehensive video technology system consisting of a center-hung scoreboard, 270-degree ribbon board, 4 elevated auxiliary corner boards, two vomitory digital boards and two court-level scorer’s and broadcast table boards, creating a multidimensional technology experience with advanced lighting & sound

Broadcast suite incorporating a filming studio, two broadcast control rooms, camera shading and rack room

Auxiliary multipurpose event space

Student club area adjacent to student seating

Dedicated media seating area on concourse level

Aramark's nationally-branded restaurant Tenders, Love and Chicken with separate entrance for non-event operating hours

Team store operated by campus merchandise partner, Follett

Four concession areas around main concourse

12 restrooms along main concourse

Four auxiliary and officials locker rooms

Practice gymnasium with seven shooting stations and high windows for natural light

Coaches offices and conference rooms overlooking practice gymnasium

Academic success space with dedicated advisor office space, two private tutoring spaces and open work areas

Strength & conditioning training area consisting of a lower strength area and mezzanine cardio area

Sports medicine evaluation space with independent hydrotherapy room & three different pool types

Team meeting rooms and locker rooms

Event-level areas designated for food preparation, storage and facility infrastructure needs

Loading bay with dedicated broadcast truck parking area

Offices for facilities & events and ticket operations

Working media and press conference space

Adjacent 1,500-car parking deck featuring dedicated access road

LEED certification

Atlantic Union Bank Center - Tickets, Parking & Seating Maps

Season tickets for the 2022-23 Men's and Women's Basketball seasons can be ordered online at JMUTickets.com

Tickets for events in the Atlantic Union Bank Center can be ordered online at JMUTickets.com. Fans can get a glimpse of seat options via JMU's 3D seating software.

The JMU Athletics Ticket Office is located at the Plaza Entrance of the Atlantic Union Bank Center, with typical business hours Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Directions

Parking for events in the Atlantic Union Bank Center is located in the Ballard Parking Deck (649 University Blvd), which is accessible via the directions below.

From the North:

-Interstate 81 South, take Exit 247B, East Market Street/US Route 33.

-At second traffic light, turn right onto University Blvd.

-After crossing intersection for Reservoir St, turn right at traffic light for East Campus Drive to access the Ballard Parking Deck.

From the South:

-Interstate 81 North, take Exit 245, Port Republic Road.

-Go straight through the light off the exit ramp onto Forest Hill Road.

-At the first stop sign, turn left onto University Blvd.

-Proceed straight at the traffic light for Carrier Drive.

-Atlantic Union Bank Center will be on the left following the light.

-Ballard Parking Deck can be accessed by turning left at the next traffic light onto East Campus Drive.
